alert.note: Alert for Campbell; Grant; Kenton; Owen; Pendleton (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 11:44AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHERN KENTON, SOUTHERN CAMPBELL, GRANT, EAST CENTRAL OWEN AND NORTHERN PENDLETON COUNTIES THROUGH 1215 PM EDT... At 1144 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Williamstown, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Williamstown, Crittenden, Dry Ridge, Butler, Stewartsville, Northcutt, Bracht, Gardnersville, Fiskburg, Sherman, Goforth, Greenwood, Cherry Grove, Morning View, Williamstown Lake, Knoxville, Twin Bridges, Keefer, Catawba and Needmore. This includes I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 149 and 167. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
